issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

fields.summary: TiAPI: Review and clean up platform bugs and reduce bug count by 20%.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
{html}

goes back to 1.4.0 at least

1.create a simple iOS project and launch it in the emulator
2.check the ouput in TiDev
3.do the same on android and compare

iOS:[INFO] Titanium SDK version: 1.6.0
Android:[INFO] Titanium SDK version: 1.6.0 (01/12/11 09:38 db09d1e)

the info shown by android is useful and should be included on the iOS side.

{html}
fields.summary: iOS emulator - [info] build output soes not include date or hash like android does.

comments.body: Timestamp/hash is shown in builds with SDK 2.2.0.014b86f.
